reference.title: AArch32 PMU registers
reference.shortdesc: This chapter describes the AArch32 PMU registers and shows examples of how to use them.

link.desc: The PMU counters and their associated control registers are accessible in the AArch32 Execution state from the internal CP15 system register interface with MCR and MRC instructions for 32-bit registers and MCRR and MRRC for 64-bit registers.

link.linktext: PMCEID0, Performance Monitors Common Event Identification Register 0 (Ares/Enyo Specific)
link.desc: The PMCEID0 defines which common architectural and common microarchitectural feature events are implemented.

link.linktext: PMCEID1, Performance Monitors Common Event Identification Register 1 (Ares/Enyo Specific)
link.desc: The PMCEID1 defines which common architectural and common microarchitectural feature events are implemented.
The PMCR provides details of the Performance Monitors implementation, including the number of counters implemented, and configures and controls the counters.
